Successors of the Satavahanas

After the decline of the Satavahana empire, the Ikshvakus established their rule in the Krishna-Guntur region. Their capital was Vijayapuri (modern Nagarjunakonda). They traced their lineage to the mythical solar dynasty (Ikshvaku). The founder king was Vasishthiputra Sri Shantmul, who performed the Ashvamedha sacrifice.

тШ╕я╕П
Golden Age of Buddhism

The Ikshvaku reign was a golden age for Buddhist art and architecture in Andhra. Although the kings followed Vedic religion, their queens were great patrons of Buddhism. They built magnificent stupas, chaityas, and viharas in the Nagarjunakonda valley. Mahayana Buddhism flourished significantly here.

тП│
Legacy

Ikshvaku inscriptions show the use of both Sanskrit and Prakrit. The dynasty ended with the rise of the Pallavas, who expanded their power from Kanchipuram.
